articles.description: Indian Bank has hiked interest rates on fixed deposits for an amount below Rs 2 crore with effect from June 1, 2022.

articles.author: ET CONTRIBUTORS
articles.title: View: There is more to India's inflation problem than meets the eye - Economic Times
articles.description: CPI inflation is expected to touch 6.3% average this fiscal from 5.5% in the last. Given this, the Reserve Bank of India is expected to raise the policy repo rate by another 75-100 basis points (bps), taking the cumulative rate hike for the year to 115-140 bp…
articles.content:
A and broad-based increase in prices is the biggest headwind consumers are facing today. The other worry is a concomitant increase in interest rates.
